sub_topic: Calculation of efficiency of a refrigerator
message_1: A refrigerator is designed to operate between the temperatures of 5°C and -15°C. If the refrigerator consumes 800 J of work along with the heat absorbed from the surroundings, and removes heat at the rate of 1200 J per second, what is the coefficient of performance (COP) of the refrigerator?
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a refrigerator is defined as the ratio of the heat removed from the cold reservoir (Q_c) to the work done on the system (W). In other words, it tells us how efficiently the refrigerator is operating.

COP = Q_c / W

We are given that the refrigerator consumes 800 J of work (W) and removes heat at the rate of 1200 J per second (Q_c).

W = 800 J
Q_c = 1200 J

Now, we can calculate the COP of the refrigerator:

COP = Q_c / W
COP = 1200 J / 800 J
COP = 1.5

The coefficient of performance of the refrigerator is 1.5. This means that for every 1 Joule of work done on the system, the refrigerator removes 1.5 Joules of heat from the cold reservoir.
